TopicTitle: No Trajectory Lines in Map View [Indicators Like PE/AP are Still Showing]

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.4 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows | CPU: Intel i5-10300H | GPU: Gtx 1650 Ti | RAM: 16gb

 

After updating to 0.1.4.0, I logged on to find that I am unable to see trajectories for any of my crafts while in map view.  I was previously able to on 0.1.3. and most other previous versions. It is clear the trajectories are there, but having no lines makes interplanetary missions almost impossible. Thank you for reviewing and hopefully fixing soon!

 

Included Attachments:

With help from the community on Discord and @Vortygont's log file and two log files supplied by @ShadowZone I have been able to reproduce this 100% of the time.

@Suppise Thanks for initially directing me to issues with the F2 key in mapview.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Load a save with a craft in orbit
  2. Go to Map View
  3. Press F2 twice
  4. Go to Flight View
  5. Press F2 twice
  6. F5
  7. F9
  8. Go to Map View

Thank you to everyone who has had issues with this and came forward with suggestions on the cause.

I can't promise that the F2 key is the only cause of this, but the steps above create the same situation exactly.

If this is happening without any use of the F2 key please DM me here on the forums, or DM me on discord, and if you have a log file it would be appreciated.

yup, I've had this issue in both 0.1.3.2 and 0.1.4.0.

Closing the game and reopening it fixes it in my experience.

5 hours ago, Dandoesstuff said:

i'm pretty sure there's a mod called "community fixes" that has a fix for this?

I think that's a new bug. It doesn't seem to be the Landed bug that still exist in some instance, because in this new bug is affecting other craft and the AP/PE is still there. 

Edited August 31, 2023 by Spicat
I made a new save in 1.4 and also experienced this issue after loading a quick save.

Just had this after getting a space plane sub-orbital. Only AP and impact site showing and unable to make manoeuvre node.

Quitting to Main Menu did not fix but quitting game and restarting did.

This bug has happened a couple times to me lately. Both times, it was after a quickload because of anothe bug: the maneuver tooltip was disappearing under my mouse. I would go to my trajectory, click a point to set up a maneuver, move the mouse up to hit the create maneuver button, but the tooltip would disappear once I moused off the trajectory. Perhaps these two bugs are related.

Apologies if this has been said before, but could be an issue with the craft having a landed state?

I had a craft with the orbit line not visible, and while I was cleaning up my orbits by removing some debris, I noticed a craft that I didn't know about showing as "landed" on kerbin. I hit "recover" and then my bugged craft dissapeared. I reloaded an earlier save, saved again and saw that the craft had the "landed state", despite having an SMA of over 1 million. 

Manually editing the save from `"Situation": "Landed"` to `"Situation": "Orbiting"` (and then loading that save) brings the orbit line back, so it seems that is a fix for now that doesn't involve re-opening the entire game. You can use any text editor to edit the save file, since it's just a JSON file. I use VS Code to edit the file because I already have it installed, but I'd reccomend Notepad++, but you can of course use regular Notepad if you want. 

I've no idea why the craft is being given the landed state, but from the other posts here it seems like there's several potential causes. 

Hopefully this helps those of us with slow computers who'd have to wait 20 minutes to relaunch the game
I'm having the same issue every time I play WITHOUT touching F2. This occurs every time I revert to VAB, and occasionally when reloading a save file.

Pro tip for anyone using Dropbox to distribute files: If you set the &dl=0 to &dl=1 then it will be a 1 click download. No opening a new page.

Edit: Also, although the file says 'logs' in it, there's no KSP log or Unity player.log

Those could be more helpful than the dxdiag that was in there. Probably a lot of exceptions in there . Just a hunch.
